https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

:v: scholzhannah can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11578179359/job/32231370225)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11578179359/job/32231370993)
bors d+

maintainer merge

apart from the last batch of comments below. Thanks!

Thanks, it's good to have these more-bundled versions.

I'll probably have a few more comments on naming once the `Fin.append` thing is resolved.

maintainer merge

apart from the last batch of comments below. Thanks!
bors d+
I think it might be best to construct this explicitly with `Fin.append`, rather than build it through composition; that way you get the fact that it is equal to `Fin.append` by definition.

I think this one probably isn't worth having, unless there's precedent in the non-homeomorph versions.

If you do decide to keep it based on that, please change `def` to `abbrev` (here and on the other `function` specializations) so that we don't need API about both.
I think you can probably drop `ofFintype` from the name here and below, since the metric space structure is present in the instance for metric spaces on pi types
Can you replace `by apply` with ` ` here?
Unfortunately that does not work
Strange!

```suggestion
/-- `Equiv.piCongrLeft'` as an `IsometryEquiv`: this is the natural
```
right?

Slightly shorter:
```suggestion
  toFun fg := Fin.append fg.1 fg.2
  invFun f := âŸ¨fun i â†¦ f (Fin.castAdd n i), fun i â†¦ f (Fin.natAdd m i)âŸ©
  left_inv fg := by simp
  right_inv f := by
    unfold Fin.append Fin.addCases
    simp
```

I think the `unfold` here indicates we have a missing lemma; can you add
```lean
theorem Fin.append_castAdd_natAdd :
    (Fin.append (fun i => f (Fin.castAdd n i)) fun i => f (Fin.natAdd m i)) = f := rfl
```
near `FIn.append` so that we can avoid the `unfold`?

It's super helpful to put 
```suggestion
@[simps]
def Equiv.finArrowProdEquivFinAddArrow {Î± : Type*} (m n : â„•) :
```
on definitions like these, as then Lean generates a `@[simp]` (no `s`) lemma explaining what the forward and reverse directions of the map are.
I suspect a better name for this would be `Fin.appendEquiv`. Perhaps @YaelDillies has opinions on naming here.
Yes I agree. That would match `Fin.snocEquiv` and friends. Do you think you could also make it dependent?
`Fin.append` is not dependent so I think that is out of scope.
Right
These three should all have `@[simps]`
Can you define this one to be defeq to the one in the other file, and then add `simps` too?

```suggestion
def _root_.Fin.appendIsometry (m n : â„•) : (Fin m â†’ Î±) Ã— (Fin n â†’ Î±) â‰ƒáµ¢ (Fin (m + n) â†’ Î±) :=
```
as this is an `Isometry` not a `Homeomorph`
Is a helper lemma that says `edist (append x y) (append x2 y2) = max (edist x x2) (edist y y2)` helpful here?

Using the names of instances like this should be a last resort; typically next to the instance, you'll find the lemma that does what you actualy want. In this case, it's `edist_pi_def`. Similarly for `Prod.pseudoEMetricSpaceMax` and a few others below.

Referring to `mk` directly isn't very idiomatic; I think this would be better spelt as
```suggestion
def sumArrowEquivProdArrow [Fintype Î±] [Fintype Î²] : (Î± âŠ• Î² â†’ Î³) â‰ƒáµ¢ (Î± â†’ Î³) Ã— (Î² â†’ Î³) where
  toEquiv := Equiv.sumArrowEquivProdArrow _ _ _
  isometry_toFun x := by
```
which while longer, is more idiomatic.

```suggestion
    append (fun i â†¦ f (castAdd n i)) (fun i â†¦ f (natAdd m i)) = f := by
```
feels more readable

I'm surprised you need to import this here. Is it not already transitively imported?
```suggestion
```
I thought so, too. But lean does not find `Finset.sup_univ_eq_iSup` if I take the import away.

```suggestion
/-- `Equiv.sumArrowEquivProdArrow` as a homeomorphism. The natural homeomorphism
```
Can you also add that `sumArrowEquivProdArrow.toHomeomorph = .sumArrowEquivProdArrow`?

Could this be
```suggestion
def _root_.Fin.appendHomeomorph (m n : â„•) : (Fin m â†’ X) Ã— (Fin n â†’ X) â‰ƒâ‚œ (Fin (m + n) â†’ X) :=
```
and can you please show `appendHomeomorph.toEquiv = appendEquiv`?
Would it make sense to have a lemma stating that before and then define `Fin.appendHomeomorph` using `Fin.appendEquiv` so that they could be definitionally equal?
Sorry, I'm not sure I understand your suggestion. How can you prove `appendHomeomorph.toEquiv = appendEquiv` before `appendHomeomorph` is defined?
I mean showing that `appendEquiv` is equal to the composition that I right now define `appendHomeomorph` to be.

> and then define `Fin.appendHomeomorph` using `Fin.appendEquiv` so that they could be definitionally equal?

I think this is a good idea, though it might be sensible to add the basic `Continuous fun p => Fin.append p.1 p.2` as a lemma too.
Maybe. You can try! If you do so, I suggest making that lemma `private`
and similarly that `Fin.appendIsometry.toHomeomorph = Fin.appendHomeomorph`?

I feel like `Fin.appendEquiv_eq_Homeomorph` could be nicer using `isHomeomorph_iff_exists_homeomorph` but that is further down the file. Maybe there could be a lemma like this for constructing `Homeomorph`s from `Equiv`s?
I tend to agree, but if you want to try that out, you should do so in another PR (probably after this one since this one is almost ready)

```suggestion
/-- The natural `Equiv` between `(Fin m â†’ Î±) Ã— (Fin n â†’ Î±)` and `Fin (m + n) â†’ Î±`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The natural homeomorphism `(Î¹ âŠ• Î¹' â†’ X) â‰ƒâ‚œ (Î¹ â†’ X) Ã— (Î¹' â†’ X)`.
`Equiv.sumArrowEquivProdArrow` as a homeomorphism. -/
```
to make sure people have a natural language statement before a Lean one

```suggestion
/-- The natural homeomorphism between `(Fin m â†’ X) Ã— (Fin n â†’ X)` and `Fin (m + n) â†’ X`. -/
```

```suggestion
/--The natural isometry `âˆ€ i, Y i â‰ƒáµ¢ âˆ€ j, Y (e.symm j)` obtained from a bijection `Î¹ â‰ƒ Î¹'` of fintypes.
`Equiv.piCongrLeft'` as an `IsometryEquiv`. -/
```
Same here
And here can we have the natural language statement?
I'm not sure it adds much value, since it just restates the type anyway.
At least we should be consistent

```suggestion
/-- The natural `IsometryEquiv` between `(Fin m â†’ Î±) Ã— (Fin n â†’ Î±)` and `(Fin (m + n) â†’ Î±)`.
`Fin.appendEquiv` as an isometry. -/
```

```suggestion
fintypes. `Equiv.piCongrLeft'` as an `IsometryEquiv`. -/
```

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem _root_.Fin.appendIsometry_toHomeomorph (m n : â„•) :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Homeomorphisms and IsometryEquivs based on `Equiv.piCongrLeft` and `Equiv.sumArrowEquivProdArrow`
